result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:01 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Thomas J. Sanapaw in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has applied for court appointed counsel and has paid $200.00 deposit. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Def. makes remarks regarding payments. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court reviews case history. Def. needs to get court appointed atty fee in. Court orders Def. to mandatory appearance on next court date. 
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:13 PM Defendant Thomas J. Sanapaw in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin by Zoom. Court reviews background of case. Court quashes warrant. Court reviews charges and penalties, reviews options for counsel - PD, hire own or court-appointed. Def. wants court-appointed attny. Court advises Def. he must first apply for PD. State heard on bond, recommends $200 cash bond. Def. heard on bond. Court in recess at 1:21 p.m. Back on the record at 1:23 p.m. The Court orders $200 cash bond. State requests conditions no controlled substances.. The Court orders conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
